intro: Calothamnus schoenophyllus, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a low-growing shrub with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers in spring. The plant belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Calothamnus schoenophyllus is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
